revised_title: Exploring the Rate of Camel Travel and Its Application to Geography
tldr: The author, James Rennell, examines the rate of camel travel and its application to geography, particularly in the context of African travel. He compares the time taken by various travelers between different locations, such as Aleppo, Bagdad, and Bussorah, to determine the consistency of camel travel rates. This information can be used to create a more accurate scale for geographical mapping and understanding of the African continent.
